title: the Schedule to, the Infectious Diseases Regulations 1981 (S.I. No. 390 of 1981)
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Statistics (Global Value Chains) Order
text_raw: 1. This Order may be cited as the Statistics (Global Value Chains) Order
text_norm: 1 order may cited statistic (global value chains) order

title: the Schedule to, the Infectious Diseases Regulations 1981 (S.I. No. 390 of 1981)
the Schedule to, the Infectious Diseases Regulations 1981 (S.I. No. 390 of 1981)
heading: In this Order -
text_raw:
2. 

In this Order - 

“Covid-19” means a disease caused by infection with the virus SARS-CoV-2 
and specified as an infectious disease in accordance with Regulation 6 of, and 
the Schedule to, the Infectious Diseases Regulations 1981 (S.I. No. 390 of 1981) 
or any variant of the disease so specified as an infectious disease in those 
Regulations; 

“survey” means the Global Value Chains Survey that is conducted by the Central 
Statistics Office for the purposes of obtaining the information referred to in 
Article 4.
text_norm: 2 order - covid-19 mean disease caused infection virus sars-cov-2 specified infectious disease accordance regulation 6 schedule infectious disease regulation 1981 (s.i no 390 1981) variant disease specified infectious disease regulation survey mean global value chain survey conducted central statistic office purpose obtaining information referred article 4

title: the Schedule to, the Infectious Diseases Regulations 1981 (S.I. No. 390 of 1981)
heading: 3. This Order applies to an undertaking that-
text_raw:
3. This Order applies to an undertaking that- 

(a) 

engages 50 or more persons, and 

(b) 

is classified for statistical purposes under section B, C, D, E, F, 
G, H, I, J, K, L, M, or N of NACE Rev. 2 set out in Annex I to 
Regulation (EC) No. 1893/2006 of the European Parliament and 
of the Council of 20 December 20061, as amended by Regulation 
(EC) No. 295/2008 of the European Parliament and of the Council 
of 11 March 20082, Regulation (EU) No. 70/2012 of the European 
Parliament and of the Council of 18 January 2012 3 and 
Regulation (EU) 2019/1243 of the European Parliament and of 
the Council of 20 June 20194.
text_norm: 3 order applies undertaking that- (a) engages 50 person (b) classified statistical purpose section b c e f g h j k l n nace rev 2 set annex regulation (ec) no 1893 2006 european parliament council 20 december 20061 amended regulation (ec) no 295 2008 european parliament council 11 march 20082 regulation (eu) no 70 2012 european parliament council 18 january 2012 3 regulation (eu) 2019 1243 european parliament council 20 june 20194

title: the Schedule to, the Infectious Diseases Regulations 1981 (S.I. No. 390 of 1981)
heading: 4. A requirement on undertakings to which this Order applies to provide,
text_raw:
4. A requirement on undertakings to which this Order applies to provide, 
once only and for the purposes of the survey, information the general nature of 
which is specified in the Schedule is hereby prescribed. 

1 OJ No. L 393, 30.12.2006, p. 1. 
2 OJ No. L 97, 9.4.2008, p. 13. 
3 OJ No. L 32, 3.2.2012, p. 1. 
4 OJ No. L 198, 25.7.2019, p. 241. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 9th April, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 SCHEDULE 

[166] 3 

Article 4 

Information in relation to the years 2018 to 2020 regarding the following,
text_norm: 4 requirement undertaking order applies provide purpose survey information general nature specified schedule hereby prescribed 1 oj no l 393 30.12.2006 p 1 2 oj no l 97 9.4.2008 p 13 3 oj no l 32 3.2.2012 p 1 4 oj no l 198 25.7.2019 p 241 notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 9th april 2021 schedule 166 3 article 4 information relation year 2018 2020 regarding following

title: the Schedule to, the Infectious Diseases Regulations 1981 (S.I. No. 390 of 1981)
heading: as it relates to the undertaking concerned:
text_raw:
1. 
as it relates to the undertaking concerned: 

(a) 

the number of persons engaged at the end of the year 2020 
per business function; 

(b) 

international sourcing of business functions; 

(c) 

motivations for, and barriers to, international sourcing; 

(d) 

global value chain arrangements, including – 

the purchase of goods, materials and services 

(i) 
from, and 

(ii) 

the supply of goods, materials and services to, 

undertakings outside the State; 

(e) 

(f) 

the impact of Covid-19 on international sourcing, 
turnover and global value chain arrangements in the year 
2020; 

the impact of the withdrawal of the United Kingdom of 
Great Britain and Northern Ireland from the European 
Union on decisions relating to international sourcing to, 
and from, the United Kingdom of Great Britain and 
Northern Ireland. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [166] 

Information on the time taken by the undertaking concerned to complete
text_norm: 1 relates undertaking concerned (a) number person engaged end year 2020 per business function (b) international sourcing business function (c) motivation barrier international sourcing (d) global value chain arrangement including - purchase good material service (i) (ii) supply good material service undertaking outside state (e) (f) impact covid-19 international sourcing turnover global value chain arrangement year 2020 impact withdrawal united kingdom great britain northern ireland european union decision relating international sourcing united kingdom great britain northern ireland 4 166 information time taken undertaking concerned complete

title: the Schedule to, the Infectious Diseases Regulations 1981 (S.I. No. 390 of 1981)
heading: the questionnaire, form or other record prepared by the Director General for the
text_raw:
2. 
the questionnaire, form or other record prepared by the Director General for the 
collection of the information referred to in paragraph 1. 

GIVEN under my hand, 

30 March, 2021. 

JACK CHAMBERS, 

Minister of State at the Department of the Taoiseach.
